Description: Glazed steatite cowroid with an undecorated back, longitudinally pierced, the base inscribed with a cartouche enclosing the prenomen of Thutmose III and decorated with a motif of a lotus entwined around the tail of a uraeus with the hieroglyphs for `breathe of life' at the lower sides, and two strokes as space-fillers.
Curator's comments: Published: Hall, Catalogue.no. 477; Petrie, Hist. scarabs.no. 870; Jaeger, Essai (OBO.SA 2). p. 290 n. 179 (Tuthmose I)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Lt-Gen Augustus W H Meyrick
